bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 110 (Wednesday, July 15, 2015)][Pages H5237-H5238]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DesJARLAIS:H.R. 3073.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H5238]]Article I, Section 8, Clause 4 of the United StatesConstitution

summary.text:
Sanctuary City All Funding Elimination Act of 2015 or the SAFE Act of 2015

This bill prohibits a state or local government from receiving federal financial assistance if it restricts or prohibits a government entity or official from: (1) sending to or receiving from the responsible federal immigration agency information regarding an individual's citizenship or immigration status, or (2) maintaining or exchanging information about an individual's status.

The prohibition shall be lifted when a state or local government submits a comprehensive plan to no longer restrict or prohibit such actions.

bill.title: SAFE Act of 2015

item.title: To prohibit the receipt of Federal financial assistance by sanctuary cities, and for other purposes.
Sanctuary City All Funding Elimination Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Border Security.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
